intro: Boechera acutina, commonly known as the sharpleaf rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and small white or yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Boechera acutina typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in mountainous regions and is considered a perennial herb.
